newsitem.title: USA: US group slams PSE&G, Wash. Public, NU nuke plants. [CORRECTED 16:01 GMT]
newsitem.headline: US group slams PSE&G, Wash. Public, NU nuke plants. [CORRECTED 16:01 GMT]

text.p: The Salem 1 nuclear unit owned by Public Service Electric and Gas is the worst nuclear reactor in the United States, according to consumer advocates Public Citizen.

The Salem County, New Jersey unit was closely followed by Washington Public Power Supply System's Washington Nuclear 2 unit in Richland, Washington, and Northeast Utilities' Millstone 2 unit in Haddam Neck, Connecticut.
Public Citizen slammed the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for failing to clamp down on safety lapses at commercial reactors around the country.

"The NRC has the data. They've just shown an unwillingness to implement it," said James Riccio, the main author of the group's biennial report, "Nuclear Lemons," which ranks all of the nation's commercial reactors.
All three Millstone units, which are currently shut down, are on the NRC's watchlist and require commission approval before they can start operating again.

Three other units on the NRC watchlist, Commonwealth Edison Co's Dresden 2 and 3 in Morris, Illinois, and New York Power Authority's Indian Point 3, were among the 25 worst reactors on Public Citizen's list. (Corrects ownership of Indian Point 3 nuclear plant.)
